oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Children selling flowers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Two children, natives of Clinch Mountain, peddling wildflowers to tourists on U.S. Highway 25-E. They are both wearing hats, and stand near a wooden post. The guardrail of the highway is visible in the background
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: United States Highway 25; Photography of children; Rural children; Appalachians (People); Mountain people--Southern States; Mountain people; Children's clothing; Clinch Mountain (Tenn. and Va.)
Children; Roads; Vending stands; Bouquets; Flower arrangements; Wildflowers
